bibl.title: City of the Sharp-nosed Fish. Greek Lives in Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: 1 tabl., 3 figg. n./bl., 33 figg. coul., 1 carte.

Prologue. - 1. Excavating Egypt. - 2. A Wealth of Garbage. - 3. Egyptian Greeks. - 4. 'Glorious and Most Glorious City'. - 5. Lord and God. - 6. The River. - 7. Markets. - 8. Family and Friends. - 9. Poets and Pedants. - 10. Bureaucrats. - 11. Surviving. - 12. Christians and Christianities. - Epilogue. - Bibliography. Notes. Index.
PARSONS Peter, City of the Sharp-nosed Fish. Greek Lives in Roman Egypt.
London, Weidenfeld and Nicolson, 2007, 8°, xxx-258 pp., 1 tabl., 3 figg. n./bl., 33 figg. coul., 1 carte. ISBN 978-0-297-64588-7 (hbk) / 978-0-7538-2233-3 (pbk). £20 (hbk) / £9.99 (pbk).
